metadata.feature_description: Create and manage custom friendly URLs for pages with support for multiple locales and portal aliases

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Create valid custom URL with standard path

steps.action: Navigate to Content > Pages > Home > Advanced > S.E.O. tab
steps.expected: URLs for this page section visible with Add URL button
steps.actual: URLs section displayed with existing automatic URL '/' and Add URL button

steps.expected: Add URL form opens with Site Alias, URL Path, and URL Type fields
steps.actual: Form opened with all required fields visible

steps.action: Enter '/my-custom-home-url' in URL Path field with Active (200) status
steps.expected: URL path accepted in text field
steps.actual: URL path entered successfully

steps.expected: URL saved and appears in the list
steps.actual: URL '/my-custom-home-url' saved successfully and visible in URL list as Active (200)

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Create custom URL with special characters requiring cleaning

steps.action: Click Add URL and enter 'special@chars#test!url' in URL Path
steps.expected: System accepts or cleans special characters
steps.actual: System displays validation message about invalid characters

steps.expected: System cleans URL by removing invalid characters
steps.actual: URL cleaned to 'specialchars-test-url' - removed @, #, and !

steps.expected: Cleaned URL is saved successfully
steps.actual: URL '/specialchars-test-url' saved and visible in list

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Attempt to create duplicate URL and verify error handling

steps.action: Click Add URL and enter existing URL '/specialchars-test-url'
steps.expected: System detects duplicate and shows error
steps.actual: System displayed error and suggested alternative '/specialchars-test-url1'

steps.expected: Clear error message about URL already existing
steps.actual: Error message displayed with suggested alternative URL

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Validate required fields (path, locale, site alias)

steps.action: Click Add URL and observe default values
steps.expected: Form shows default values for required fields
steps.actual: Site Alias defaulted to 'localhost:8081/en-us', URL Path defaulted to '/', URL Type defaulted to 'Active (200)'

steps.action: Verify Save button behavior with default '/' path
steps.expected: Save button enabled when required fields have values
steps.actual: Save button enabled - '/' is considered valid minimum path value

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Create URL with different status codes (200 Active, 301 Redirect)

steps.action: Click URL Type dropdown to view available options
steps.expected: Dropdown shows Active (200) and Redirect (301) options
steps.actual: Both status code options visible in dropdown

steps.action: Select Redirect (301) and observe form changes
steps.expected: Query String field appears for redirect URLs
steps.actual: Query String field appeared after selecting Redirect (301)

steps.expected: Redirect URL created successfully
steps.actual: URL '/redirect-to-home' created with Redirect (301) status

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Create URL with query string parameters

steps.action: Click Add URL, select Redirect (301), enter '/query-test' path
steps.expected: Form accepts path and shows Query String field
steps.actual: Query String field visible for redirect URL type

steps.expected: Query string accepted
steps.actual: Query string entered; system auto-prefixed with '?'

steps.expected: URL with query string saved
steps.actual: URL '/query-test' saved successfully with query parameters

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test URL path cleaning and normalization

steps.expected: System normalizes/cleans the URL
steps.actual: URL cleaned to 'specialchars-test-url', invalid characters (@, #, !) removed and replaced with dashes where appropriate

steps.action: Enter very long URL path (over 200 characters)
steps.expected: System accepts or truncates long URL
steps.actual: Long URL accepted and saved successfully

steps.expected: Long URL saved
steps.actual: Long URL saved and displayed (truncated in UI for display purposes)

steps.action: Click delete icon on URL row
steps.expected: Confirmation dialog appears
steps.actual: Delete confirmation dialog displayed with 'Are you sure you want to remove this URL?' message

steps.action: Click Delete button in confirmation dialog
steps.expected: URL removed from list
steps.actual: Long URL deleted successfully, removed from URL list

steps.expected: Edit form opens with current values
steps.actual: Edit form opened showing current URL path, Site Alias, URL Type, and Query String fields

steps.expected: Field accepts new value
steps.actual: URL path modified successfully

steps.expected: URL updated in list
steps.actual: URL updated to '/my-custom-home-url-edited' and displayed in list

observations: When creating a new Active (200) URL, previous custom Active URLs are automatically changed to Redirect (301) status
The system auto-prefixes '/' to URL paths if not provided
Query String field only appears when URL Type is set to Redirect (301)
The system auto-prefixes '?' to query string values
URL path cleaning removes invalid characters (@, #, !) and the user must click Save again to accept the cleaned version
Duplicate URL detection suggests alternative URLs by appending numbers (e.g., 'url1')
Custom URLs are managed per-page via Pages > Advanced > S.E.O. tab, not in a global URL Management section
The first icon in each URL row is the delete button, the second icon is the edit button
Long URLs are accepted by the system but may be truncated in the display for readability
